titlepage.titleproper: Inventory of the Robert Morris Diary, 1845-1848
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in the
Special Collections Research Center Mss. 2000.M83
titlepage.publisher: Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Diary of a schoolteacher and farmer who lived in James City County, Virginia as well as in Williamsburg and in Warwick County, Virginia. He rented the Presidents House at the College of William and Mary. Includes comments on church meetings, schools, local people and weather. Also includes lists of students attending his schools in Williamsburg and Warwick County.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Manuscripts and Rare Books Librarian, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Robert Morris Diary, Special Collections Research Center, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were acquired by Special Collections Research Center from Mrs. Betty L. Lokey on 06/14/2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Robert Morris, 19th century schoolteacher and farmer who lived in James City County, Va. as well as in Williamsburg and in Warwick County, Va. At one time he rented the presidents house at the College of William and Mary.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Diary of a schoolteacher and farmer who lived in James City County, Virginia as well as in Williamsburg and in Warwick County, Virginia. He rented the Presidents House at the College of William and Mary. Includes comments on church meetings, schools, local people and weather. Also includes lists of students attending his schools in Williamsburg and Warwick County.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics or Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Original diary cannot be handled. Patrons must use photocopy of the diary.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.
